helperSigners: The total number of possible signers (max 99)
helperSigThreshold: The number of signers needed to approve a proposal
subTitleSignerAddresses: These users are able to submit and approve proposals
labelConnectWallet: To deploy a new Safe DAO
helperNFTWeight: How many votes is this token worth?
helperChooseGovernance: How would you like to govern your DAO?
helperVotingPeriod: The length of time (in minutes) voting is allowed after proposal creation
helperQuorum: The percentage of total possible token votes required to vote on a proposal to make the result valid
helperQuorumThreshold: The required votes out of the available voting weight needed to make the result valid
governanceDescription: These values can be changed later via a proposal
helperExecutionPeriod: The length of time (in minutes) a successful proposal must be executed within
helperTimelockPeriod: The length of time (in minutes) a passed proposal must wait to be executed on the blockchain
helperFreezeVotesThreshold: Total votes required by the parent (out of {{totalVotes}}) to freeze this sub-Safe entirely
helperFreezeProposalPeriod: The length of time (in minutes) for a Freeze Vote's starting and ending point
helperFreezePeriod: The length of time (in minutes) a successful Freeze Vote will freeze this sub-Safe
freezeGuardDescription: These configuration values may be changed later on by passing a proposal to do so on this sub-Safe
helperParentAllocation: The total number of tokens claimable by all parent token holders
helperTokenName: What is your governance token called?
helperTokenSymbol: The symbol for your token (2-6 chars)
descAzoriusErc20Gov: ERC-20 token voting governance on a Safe
descAzoriusErc721Gov: Assign voting rights and ownership privileges to ERC-721 token holders
helperAllocations: Unallocated tokens will be placed in your Safe DAO's treasury
helperSelectToken: Create a new token or use an existing ERC-20 token.
helperNewToken: Create a new ERC-20 token to vote with
helperExistingToken: Use an existing ERC-20 for voting
warningExistingToken: This token must be wrapped in order to be used as a voting token
warningExistingTokenTooltip: Decent will deploy a new ERC-20 governance token to wrap this one. Holders can deposit their tokens to vote with or withdraw them at any time.
snapshotHelper: Does your Safe DAO have a Snapshot space?
tooltipMultisig: Multisig is useful when you have a small group of decision makers, a subset of whom are needed to approve proposals. <1>Learn more</1>
tooltipTokenVoting: Token Voting is a method to give a larger group of ERC-20 token holders governance power to propose and vote on transactions. <1>Learn more</1>
tooltipNftVoting: NFT Voting is good practice to give a group ERC-721 (aka NFT) holders to propose and vote on transactions. Multiple NFT addresses may be used. Learn more with <1>Decent Docs</1>
